thread.title: Trump Spokesman Goofs, Calls the Canadian Prime Minister 'Joe Trudeau'
thread.title_full: Trump Spokesman Goofs, Calls the Canadian Prime Minister 'Joe Trudeau'

author: ana.gliadkovskaya@tkc.edu (Anastassia Gliadkovskaya)
title: Trump Spokesman Goofs, Calls the Canadian Prime Minister 'Joe Trudeau'
text:
ABC News BTW 
During Tuesday’s daily White House press briefing, U.S. Press Secretary Sean Spicer misspoke the name of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau , calling him “Joe Trudeau.” Spicer was looking down at what was presumably a list of talking points. 
President Trump met with Trudeau for the first time earlier Monday to discuss trade and other cross-border efforts. ‘Joe Trudeau’? U.S. Press Secretary Sean Spicer mixed up our PM’s name today–we hear what Canadians are saying about the flub, tonight at 6. pic.twitter.com/CQCosioY9o — CTV Vancouver (@CTVVancouver) February 15, 2017 
Spicer’s stumble occurred right before questions erupted regarding the resignation of Michael Flynn , Trump’s national security adviser, who confessed to withholding details of meetings with Russian Ambassador Sergei Kislyak from Vice President Mike Pence , “and others.” 
People took to Twitter to entertain the flub. I remember Joe Trudeau. We were in grade school together. Not the sharpest knife in the drawer, but a really decent guy. https://t.co/OVlcovyeJk — John Ibbitson (@JohnIbbitson) February 14, 2017 Joe Trudeau. I remember his father and former primer minister Paul Tradeau. https://t.co/WQ0Nz7D4Kq — William Chyr (@WilliamChyr) February 14, 2017 Spicer called our Prime Minister "Joe Trudeau" but it's an improvement over last week when Trump referred to him as "Justin Who?" #cdnpoli — Andrew Grose (@GroseAndrew) February 14, 2017 Totally possible the "Joe" was the result of stumble-saying "Ju - Trudeau," not mistaken identity. But came out Joe. Now back to Russia
